According to the information, the board will conduct the Class10 and 12 examinations eight to ten days earlier than in previous years. The board has advanced the exam schedule to ensure a smoother admission process for the next academic year.

Article Title: Indian Olympic medallist Sarabjot Singh rejects government job, says the job is good but...
Article Text: NEW DELHI: 22-year-old Indian shooter and Olympic bronze medallist Sarabjot Singh has made headlines by turning down a prestigious job offer from the Haryana government .Sarabjot, who was offered the position of Deputy Director in the Sports Department, has chosen to prioritize his shooting career instead."The job is good, but I will not do it right now.I want to work on my shooting first," Sarabjot said. He acknowledged the pressure from his family to secure a stable job but emphasized his commitment to his sport. "My family has also been asking me to get a decent job, but I want to do shooting... I don't want to go against some decisions that I have made, so I cannot do a job right now," he added.Sarabjot's decision comes on the heels of his success at the Paris Olympics , where he won a bronze medal in the 10m air pistol mixed team event.Upon returning to his hometown of Dheen village in Ambala district, Haryana, the young athlete was given a hero's welcome. Family, friends, and villagers gathered to celebrate his achievement, greeting him with drumbeats, flower garlands, and the burst of crackers.The celebration was a heartfelt acknowledgement of Sarabjot's hard work and dedication. On his arrival, he first took blessings from his parents, Harjeet Kaur and Jitender Singh, before joining the jubilant crowd. The village of Dheen, brimming with pride, showered him with floral petals, and the atmosphere was filled with dance and music.While Sarabjot's decision to reject the government job might surprise some, it highlights his unwavering focus on his shooting career. His commitment to the sport has already brought him success on the international stage, and his decision suggests that he is aiming even higher in the future, and perhaps a gold in the LA 2028 Olympics .
Article Summary: Sarabjot Singh turned down a job offer from the Haryana government. The 22-year- old won a bronze medal in the 10m air pistol mixed team event at the Paris Olympics. He was offered the position of Deputy Director in the Sports Department.

Article Title: Now, BEML aims to start exporting Vande Bharat, metro trains in coming years
Article Text: Vande Bharat trains for export! BEML Ltd , a state-owned heavy equipment manufacturer, anticipates that the rail and metro segment, alongside defence, will be the most significant contributor to its revenue in the near future. The company is looking to secure export orders for Vande Bharat and metro trains within the next few years.Shantanu Roy , the chairman of BEML, told ET in an interview, "The priority is to roll out the indigenous Vande Bharat trains first.But next year, we will try and should expect something on the export front."BEML is currently manufacturing the first prototype of the Vande Bharat sleeper train set for Indian Railways , which is expected to be rolled out in the coming months.BEML told the financial daily that it aims to accelerate the Make in India initiative and is currently exploring opportunities in the Middle East, South America, and the Asean region for rail and metro exports. Roy said that BEML’s ultimate goal is of increasing exports from the current 4% to around 10% of their top line.To streamline growth, BEML has reorganized its operations this fiscal year, focusing on three key segments: mining and construction, defence, and rail and metro.Also Check | Vande Bharat sleeper & Vande Metro: Indian Railways to launch two new trains soon; top specials facts you must know The company has established 11 strategic business units (SBUs) within these segments, each headed by a CEO who will have greater decision-making power and better control over operations. BEML's consolidated net loss narrowed to Rs 70 crore for the quarter ended on June 30, 2024, while the company achieved a 10% growth in topline.Regarding profitability, Roy noted that last year's performance was significantly better than previous years. He said, "This year, we have given a guidance of 100 basis points for Ebitda growth at 13%. We aim to reach 16-17% in the near future." BEML is optimistic about its future prospects and is working towards achieving its goals in the rail, metro, and defence sectors.
Article Summary: BEML is looking to secure export orders for Vande Bharat and metro trains within the next few years. The state-owned heavy equipment manufacturer anticipates that the rail and metro segment, alongside defence, will be the most significant contributor to its revenue in the near future.

Article Title: 'Making excuses is where our country will win gold medals': Gavaskar backs Prakash Padukone over Lakshya Sen criticism
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar voiced his support for badminton legend Prakash Padukone after he called for players to take responsibility and accountability following Lakshya Sen 's defeat in the bronze medal match at the Paris Olympics last week.Lakshya let slip an opening game advantage and an 8-3 lead in the second, ultimately losing 21-13, 16-21, 11-21 to Malaysia's Lee Zii Jia in a 71-minute match.Lakshya succumbing to the pressure left Padukone miffed as the former All England Open champion said it's high time that players learn to withstand pressure, become accountable and start delivering results after receiving support.However, Padukone's remarks sparked division within the badminton community, with doubles player Ashwini Ponnappa stating that his comments were equivalent to "throwing the player under the bus."But Padukone got the backing from none other than Gavaskar, who said our country has mastered the art of making excuses and would win gold medals every time if it were a competitive discipline."He has always been reticent and publicity-shy, and he goes about his life with as much quiet as his famous dribble at the net. Therefore, his frank comments after the badminton disappointment came as a surprise to so many who have known him over the years to keep his counsel and not say much."It also stirred up a debate where the majority tried, as is the modern way, to take the side of a current would-be champion and not that of a past-proven world champion. Making excuses is where our country will win gold medals every single time, so the debate around his assessment was more about that than looking without tinted glasses at what he said," Gavaskar wrote in a column for Sportstar."And what did he say? He said that the players today get all the backing and facilities from their Federations and the government too. Therefore, they should take responsibility for their performances too. It was a point well-made and well-articulated too, without pointing fingers at anybody. Yet as it invariably happens in our country, which again is a champion at reading between so-called lines and imagining unintended poisoned arrows, we were quick to jump on him and denounce his comments rather than take the time to digest them and then come out with our comparatively uninformed views."If a player is not going to take responsibility for his performance, then who is? So what wrong did he say? Some say the timing was wrong, but it's always better to say that when a player is searching for excuses and support rather than later. Yes, he could have said that privately in the changing room, but believe me, nothing has more impact on a player than a public rebuke. If he has the heart of a champion, then he will want to make the person who rebuked him eat his words. Otherwise, he will continue to flatter only to deceive," Gavaskar added.Gavaskar drew a parallel between Lakshya's performance and a recent comment made by the Indian cricket team Rohit Sharma. He had previously used the phrase "Garden Main Ghoomne Vala" to describe a certain situation."To then see a 20-17 and 7-0 lead being squandered off in the semifinal and then lose the bronze medal match after winning the first game comfortably must have been gut-wrenching indeed. He, Vimal Kumar, the BAI and the government's TOPS had done everything possible, but when it came to the crunch, Lakshya was, in the famous words of the Indian cricket team captain," garden mein ghoomne wala," wrote Gavaskar."For those who watched both the semifinal and the bronze medal matches, it did appear that Lakshya had lost his trend of thought and concentration in the way he looked at his racquet as he sipped from his water bottle in between points or at the changeovers. I could be completely wrong, but on TV, it looked like a blank expression, and that's usually a sign that the mind has wandered."Concentration and focus are things that no coach or trainer can ever teach. It can be developed over the years by the athlete by observing other champions and having an inner resolve, but there's no specific programme for it. Yes, mind trainers are around, but they can only do so much and not more. It's got to be within the athlete," Gavaskar further stated.
Article Summary: Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar voiced his support for badminton legend Prakash Padukone. He said it's high time that players learn to withstand pressure, become accountable and start delivering results after receiving support. Lakshya Sen lost 21-13, 16-21, 11-21 to Malaysia's Lee Zii Jia in the bronze medal match.

Article Title: Eye on China & Pakistan, India fast-tracks deal for 31 US 'hunter-killer' drones
Article Text: NEW DELHI: With both China and Pakistan bolstering their fleets of armed drones , India is fast-tracking negotiations for the acquisition of 31 weaponised MQ-9B `hunter-killer’ remotely-piloted aircraft from the US, with the somewhat ambitious aim to ink the mega deal by November-December this year.Techno-commercial discussions for the inter-governmental contract for the 31 armed high-altitude, long endurance drones “are in an advanced stage now”, with 15 Sea Guardians earmarked for Navy and 8 Sky Guardians each for Army and IAF, defence ministry sources told TOI.This comes at a time when China, which continues the military confrontation in eastern Ladakh for the fifth year running now, has stepped-up supplies of its armed Cai Hong-4 and Wing Loong-II drones to Pakistan. “Pakistan has sought 16 more armed CH-4 drones from China. It already has seven CH-4 drones in the Army and 3 in Navy,” a source said.The MQ-9B Reaper or Predator-B drones, designed to fly for around 40 hours at altitudes over 40,000-feet for surveillance and armed with Hellfire air-to-ground missiles and smart bombs for precision strikes, are considered far superior to Chinese armed drones.The operational utility of the MQ-9B drones has been reinforced by extensive ISR (intelligence, surveillance, reconnaissance) missions being undertaken by the two unarmed Sea Guardian drones -- taken on lease from US firm General Atomics -- both over the vast Indian Ocean Region (IOR) as well as along the 3,488-km Line of Actual Control with China.While the US has put a price tag of $3.9 billion (over Rs 33,500 crore) for the 31 weaponised MQ-9B drones and associated equipment, including 170 Hellfire missiles, 310 GBU-39B precision-guided glide bombs, navigation systems, sensor suites and mobile ground control systems, the Indian negotiating team is working to bring the costs down.“The price and terms offered by the US govt and General Atomics to other countries is being taken into account. All efforts are underway to conclude the deal within this calendar year after the final nod from the cabinet committee on security,” a source said.Under the deal, the drones will be assembled in India, while General Atomics will also source some components from Indian companies as well as set up a global MRO (maintenance, repair, overhaul) facility here.“Since General Atomics cannot give transfer of technology for the varied sub-systems it sources from other companies, it will provide expertise and consultancy to DRDO and other entities to develop such advanced drones indigenously,” the source said.The armed forces hope to induct the first 10 MQ-9B drones within a couple of years of the contract being inked, though it will depend on General Atomics’ production capacity. The rest will come in batches every six months.The plan is to deploy the fighter-size drones at ISR command and control centres at Arakkonam and Porbandar for the Indian Ocean region and Sarsawa and Gorakhpur for the land borders. “With their long-distance hunting and killing capabilities, such drones are required at a time when China’s naval forays into the IOR are only going to increase further,” an officer said.
Article Summary: The MQ-9B Reaper or Predator-B drones are designed to fly for around 40 hours at altitudes over 40,000-feet for surveillance and armed with Hellfire air-to- ground missiles and smart bombs for precision strikes. The drones will be assembled in India, while General Atomics will also source some components from Indian companies as well as set up a global MRO facility.

Article Title: Irked by rally, Supreme Court threatens to cancel bail
Article Text:
Times View It has happened in the past that politicians accused of serious crimes have celebrated the occasion of being given bail like an acquittal. The apex court has rightly warned against over the top displays on such occasions.

NEW DELHI: Politicians , imprisoned for alleged crimes, are typically greeted by unruly celebrations by their supporters when they get bail, leading to inconvenience to the public. In what could be a cautionary tale for them, SC Tuesday took a serious view of the practice and threatened to cancel the bail it had granted to an alleged criminal of Maharashtra's Newasa for taking out a motorcade and getting showered with flowers by a JCB machine.Sopan Gade of Newasa faced several criminal cases, including a murder case of 2013. His bail plea in the murder case was rejected by trial court and Bombay HC bench at Aurangabad considering his criminal antecedents, absconding during pendency of trial and tactics to delay trial.On Tuesday, the complainant in the case, which related to murder of advocate Riyaz Pathan, complained before a bench of Justices B R Gavai and K V Viswanathan that days after SC granted bail considering that he has undergone almost a decade of incarceration, the accused roamed around Newasa town in a huge motorcade apparently to terrorise witnesses.Seeking cancellation of Sopan Gade's bail, complainant Asif Khan told SC that "On Dec 16 last year, to create his fear among the people, Sopan organised a rally in his four-wheeler accompanied by 100 to 150 four-wheelers and 70 to 80 two-wheelers. It was telecast live on social media. They burst crackers, showered flowers from JCB to felicitate the accused. The motorcade caused a traffic jam on the NH for five to six hours."The bench was furious and said it has become a habit with leaders to go around the town with supporters in a rally after getting bail. When Sopan's counsel said his supporters arranged the rally, the bench said, "You file an apology for going in a motorcade and organising a rally. You also file an undertaking that you will never indulge in any such activities in future."
Article Summary: Sopan Gade of Newasa faced several criminal cases, including a murder case of 2013. His bail plea in the murder case was rejected by trial court and Bombay HC bench at Aurangabad. The bench was furious and said it has become a habit with leaders to go around the town with supporters in a rally after getting bail. They burst crackers, showered flowers from JCB to felicitate the accused.

Article Title: Kolkata doctor rape-murder case: CBI takes over, key doctors' body ends strike -Top developments
Article Text:
Details of the crime

Arrest of Sanjay Ray

What did the autopsy reveal

Controversy over principal's reappointment

NHRC takes suo moto cognisance

HC tells doctors to call off strike

JP Nadda meets IMA chief

CBI takes over

Doctors' body calls off strike

NEW DELHI: Following the Calcutta high court's order, the Central Bureau of Investigation took over the RG Kar Medical College rape-murder case to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Tuesday. This case has placed significant scrutiny on the Mamata Banerjee-led government after a postgraduate trainee doctor was raped and murdered by a volunteer police worker.The agency promptly completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency.Meanwhile, Federation of resident doctors' association called off its strike after meeting Union minister JP Nadda.The controversy began when the victim's family revealed to the Metro that the hospital initially attempted to downplay the incident. The opposition criticised the Mamata government for forming an 11-member panel, which included interns, to investigate the case.Although Sanjay Ray was arrested with evidence and DNA tests linking him to the crime scene, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has accused the West Bengal police of mishandling the investigationInvestigative details indicate that after committing the crime, Sanjay Ray returned to police barracks to sleep. Allegedly, Ray had unrestricted access to various rooms and wards in the hospital.The incident occurred after the victim and four colleagues shared a meal in the seminar room while watching the Olympics. Her colleagues left, and she remained in the room to study. At 3am, she was last seen asleep. Around 4am, the accused allegedly entered, sexually assaulted her, and strangled her when she resisted. Her body was discovered at 7.30am.Sanjay Ray, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police , was arrested on Saturday just six hours after a seven-member Special Investigation Team ( SIT ) was formed by the police force to investigate the case.On Sunday, the most damning evidence against Sanjay Ray, the primary suspect in the rape and murder of the 31-year-old doctor, was uncovered by investigators."Traces of blood and skin found under the victim's fingernails perfectly matched Ray's DNA and corresponded to the injuries he sustained during the attack," a senior police officer stated. This evidence strongly links Ray to the heinous crime.The report concluded that the cause of death was smothering and throttling. The initial findings suggest that the victim died as a result of gagging, and there were numerous indications of injuries and struggle on the body. "The mouth and throat were constantly pressed to prevent screaming."Sanjay strangled the victim's throat to suffocate them, resulting in the fracture of the thyroid cartilage. The victim's face and eyes were stained with blood, and scratch marks were present on various parts of the body. Additionally, there was evidence of bleeding from the private parts, further indicating the violent nature of the attack.The Calcutta high court has directed Sandip Ghosh, the former principal of RG Kar Medical College, to submit a leave application by Tuesday at 3pm. Ghosh's appointment as the principal of Calcutta National Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata, which came immediately after his resignation, sparked protests."How can the principal - who resigned by taking moral responsibility, be appointed as the principal of another government college? The court has asked him to submit a leave application by 3pm today or the court will pass an order for him to leave the position," the court observed."Why are you protecting him? Record his statement. Let him tell whatever he knows," the court asked.The National Human Rights Commission on Tuesday took suo moto cognisance of the case. The commission observed that the contents of the media report, if true, raise a serious issue of violation of human rights of the victim. In response to the gravity of the situation, the commission has issued formal notices to the chief secretary and the director general of Police of West Bengal, requesting a comprehensive report on the incident within a period of two weeks.Representatives from the National Commission for Women went to the location where the crime occurred and spoke with the investigators and the victim's family members. The NCW strongly condemned the incident, describing it as "heinous," and demanded that justice be served.In its direction to transfer the case to the CBI the Calcutta high court also urged the agitating doctors to call off their strike saying that they have a "pious obligation".Demonstrations broke out in various parts of India, with medical professionals calling for a thorough inquiry by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) into recent incidents. Doctors at AIIMS Delhi, as well as hospitals in Mumbai and Nagpur, participated in the protests, urging authorities to take action and ensure better security measures for healthcare workers.The Federation of Resident Doctors' Association has resolved to continue its current indefinite strike after a fruitless discussion with officials from the Union health ministry in New Delhi.Union health minister JP Nadda met with the national president of the Indian Medical Association (IMA) Dr R V Asokan.This came after the IMA expressed their shock and dismay in a letter addressed to Nadda, and put forth five demands:The IMA urged the government to declare hospitals as safe zones and define the entitlement of this term in the law. They also called for the establishment of police camps and adequate security personnel in all major government hospitals, with similar arrangements being made mandatory in large private hospitals. The association emphasized the need for compulsory installation of CCTV cameras at vulnerable points within healthcare facilities.The Central Bureau of Investigation has taken over the investigation into the incident. The agency promptly completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency.On Wednesday early morning, a team of CBI officials from Delhi, accompanied by forensic scientists and medical experts, will visit Kolkata.The federation of resident doctors association (Forda) also met Union health minister JP Nadda and called off the protests after getting assurance of free and fair trail of the matter.
Article Summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation took over the RG Kar Medical College rape- murder case. The case has placed significant scrutiny on the Mamata Banerjee-led government. Postgraduate trainee doctor was raped and murdered by a volunteer police worker. The opposition criticised the government for forming an 11-member panel to investigate.

Article Title: 'We don't comment on ... ': What EAM Jaishankar said on US elections result
Article Text: NEW DELHI: As the election race heats up in US, India's external affair minister weighed in and reiterated that New Delhi is prepared to work with Washington , regardless of who reaches the oval office.Referring to last 2o years of relationship between the two democracies, the EAM said, "We have every confidence that we will be able to work with the president of the United States, whoever he or she will be.""Generally, we don't comment on other people's elections because we also hope others don't comment on us.But the American system will throw up its verdict. And, I'm not saying this just as a formality, but if you look over the last 20-odd years, maybe a little bit more for us, we have every confidence that we will be able to work with the president of the United States, whoever he or she will be," the EAM said at the launch of Indian diaspora's impact report in Delhi."I'm an optimistic person and generally tend to think of solutions to problems rather than the problems that come out of solutions," he said, adding that the world is going through a "exceptionally difficult period".He added that it would be a very grim forecast for the next five years.The foreign minister also referred to the Russia-Ukraine and the Israel- Hamas war, which has shown no signs of dying down."You have what you see happening in the Middle East, what you see happening in Ukraine, what you see happening in Southeast Asia, East Asia, the continued impact of the COVID which those of us who have come out of it take for granted, but many have not come out of it," the EAM said.Further pointing at the economic challenges worldwide, EAM said that many countries are struggling today."The kind of economic challenges which you see in the world, you see more and more countries struggling. You know, their trade is getting difficult, facing foreign exchange shortages, so, you know, disruptions of various kinds," he said.Jaishankar further went on and mentioned that in today' s world, climate events are also globally causing disruptive consequences."What was happening in the Red Sea, climate events which are no longer just news. I mean, they have globally disruptive consequences, and sometimes entire regions of countries being basically made dysfunctional," he said.
Article Summary: India's external affair minister reiterated that New Delhi is prepared to work with Washington, regardless of who reaches the oval office. Jaishankar said that the world is going through a "exceptionally difficult period" He added that it would be a very grim forecast for the next five years.

Article Title: Dera chief Ram Rahim on 21-day furlough; 8th outing from jail in 3 years
Article Text: CHANDIGARH: Sirsa-based Dera Sacha Sauda head Gurmeet Ram Rahim, a convict in rape and murder cases, walked out of Rohtak’s Sunaria jail on Tuesday on a 21-day furlough , his second break in 2024 from his 20-year jail sentence after he was released for 50 days in Jan, before the Lok Sabha elections.Counting the latest order, Ram Rahim has been granted furlough for a total of 253 days through eight orders since Feb 7, 2022, the year he became eligible for the facility.In other words, since Feb 7, 2022, the dera chief would have spent roughly 26% of days outside the prison .The BJP-governed Haryana and Uttar Pradesh govts gave clearances within 24 hours of his application for release, which comes ahead of assembly elections in Haryana slated for Oct, according to a scrutiny of records.On Aug 9, the Punjab and Haryana high court had vacated the stay on granting parole to the dera chief, holding that the state was competent to take a decision on such issues.Sources said that just a day after the court order, Ram Rahim applied under Section 4 of the Haryana Good Conduct Prisoners (Temporary Release) Act, 2022, for a 21-day furlough at Shah Satnam Ashram, Dera Sacha Sauda, in Baghpat, UP.The Haryana jail department immediately cleared his case. The Baghpat district magistrate, in a report issued vide letter No. 1514/JA-furlough/2024, dated Aug 11, and the Baghpat SP in a report vide letter No. DCRB-furlough 2024, also dated Aug 11, said within a few hours of being intimated that they had no objection to his release.Clearances from the UP govt were needed as the dera chief would be staying in his UP-based ashram.“The authority is satisfied that the applicant is entitled to be released under the act in view of the report of the superintendent, district jail, Rohtak. Also, the Baghpat district magistrate and superintendent of police have no objection to releasing the convict on furlough,” the Rohtak divisional commissioner observed in his Aug 12 order releasing the dera chief.The divisional commissioner, however, has ordered the officer in charge of the police station concerned to keep a close watch on the conduct and activities of the dera chief during his temporary release.The dera head is serving 20-year jail term for raping two of his disciples, and two life terms for murdering a journalist and for the murder of a former dera manager.
Article Summary: Dera Sacha Sauda head Gurmeet Ram Rahim walked out of Rohtak’s Sunaria jail on Tuesday on a 21-day furlough. It is his second break in 2024 from his 20-year jail sentence after he was released for 50 days in Jan, before the Lok Sabha elections.

Article Title: 'I made a mistake ... ': Ajit Pawar repents 'Pawar vs Pawar' contest in Baramati
Article Text:
File photo of Ajit Pawar with wife Sunetra (Middle) and cousin Supriya Sule

NEW DELHI: Maharashtra deputy chief minister and NCP chief Ajit Pawar on Tuesday regretted the "Pawar versus Pawar" electoral battle in Baramati in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Baramati Lok Sabha seat, which has been a bastion of Sharad Pawar for decades, saw an interesting contest between senior Pawar's daughter Supriya Sule and his estranged nephew's wife Sunetra Pawar .For Sharad Pawar, who had lost his party and most of his MLAs to Ajit Pawar, it was not just a prestige battle but also a test of his influence and relevance in state politics.Sharad Pawar won this battle hands down with Supriya Sule securing 51.85% of votes and Sunetra Pawar managing only 40.64%. In fact, Sharad Pawar trumped his estranged nephew comprehensively winning 8 Lok Sabha seats, his best-ever performance in Maharashtra. Ajit Pawar, on the other hand, could manage only one seat despite being a part of the BJP-led ruling alliance in the state.Reflecting on the Lok Sabha battle, Ajit Pawar said one should not allow politics to enter home. "I love all my sisters. One shouldn't allow politics to enter homes. I made a mistake in fielding Sunetra against my sister. This shouldn't have happened. But the parliamentary board (of NCP) made a decision. Now I feel it was wrong," Ajit Pawar told Marathi news channel Jai Maharashtra.Ajit Pawar, who had split the NCP in July last year and eventually got the name and symbol of the party, has been pushed to a corner after a disastrous showing in Lok Sabha elections. The NCP still does not have a minister in Modi 3.0. This after the party refused to accept minister of state with independent charge post that was being offered for its leader Praful Patel. Ajit Pawar had then said it was a conscious decision taken unanimously as Praful Patel had been a Cabinet minister at the Centre earlier and the offered post would be demotion for him.What's worse for the junior Pawar, the RSS had openly questioned the BJP's alliance with him after the Lok Sabha results were out.An article in "Organiser" magazine, which is linked to the RSS, had slammed BJP's move and called it "unnecessary politicking." It had said the induction of Ajit Pawar's NCP into NDA had reduced the brand value of BJP."Maharashtra is a prime example of unnecessary politicking and avoidable manipulations. NCP faction led by Ajit Pawar joined BJP though BJP and split SS (Shiv Sena) had a comfortable majority. Sharad Pawar would have faded away in two-three years as NCP would have lost energy with infighting between cousins," RSS lifelong member Ratan Sharda had said in the article."Why was this ill-advised step taken? BJP supporters were hurt because they had fought against this Congress ideology for years and were persecuted. In a single stroke, BJP reduced its brand value. After years of struggle to become numero uno in Maharashtra, it became just another political party without any difference," he had added.However, despite RSS criticism, Ajit Pawar remains a part of the ruling coalition for now. But as Maharashtra gears up for the year-end assembly elections, the NCP leader stares at an uncertain future. Little wonder, the junior Pawar, who was very aggressive vis-à-vis Sharad Pawar before the Lok Sabha elections, seems to have softened his stance. However, Sharad Pawar has made it clear that he can accept Ajit Pawar back only after consulting all leaders who stood with him after his nephew's rebellion.
Article Summary: Sharad Pawar trumped his estranged nephew comprehensively winning 8 Lok Sabha seats. Ajit Pawar, on the other hand, could manage only one seat despite being a part of the BJP-led ruling alliance in the state. The NCP leader has been pushed to a corner after a disastrous showing in Lok Sabha elections.

Article Title: Wish taxes could be cut to zero, but a growing India needs funds: Sitharaman
Article Text: BHOPAL: Amid complaints of high incidence of tax, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman Tuesday said that she wished taxes could brought down to almost nil, but the country was facing challenges and needed to generate resources for the country, which will help fund research and development ."There are times when being finance minister, it doesn't give me motivation when I have to answer people about why our taxes are like this.Why can't we be lower than this? I wish I could bring it down to almost nil. But India's challenges are severe and need to be overcome," Sitharaman said at the convocation ceremony at Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER)-Bhopal.Bringing tax down to near-zero is not feasible as capital is necessary for running the country, she said. The FM urged scientists to conduct more research on renewable energy and its storage - crucial for a "growing country like India" and key for a sustainable green switch.Regarding the transition where developed countries repeatedly failed to keep their words, she said, "Much money was promised by the world to transition from fossil fuel to renewable energy, but that money is yet to come. Promises made in the Paris Agreement were fulfilled with our own money."
Article Summary: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said she wished taxes could brought down to almost nil. She said the country was facing challenges and needed to generate resources for the country. The FM urged scientists to conduct more research on renewable energy and its storage.

Article Title: Supreme Court lets off Ramdev, aide from contempt with a warning
Article Text: NEW DELHI: In relief to Patanjali Ayurved founders Baba Ramdev and Acharya Balkrishna who have been facing the heat of contempt of court for last five months, SC Tuesday decided to close the proceedings against them by accepting their unconditional apology but made it clear to them that the court would be very harsh if the mistake is repeated in future.A bench of Justices Hima Kohli and Ahsanuddin Amanullah, which had initiated contempt proceedings against them on Feb 27, decided to close the case and discharge them. It, however, warned them with swift action if they do not honour the court and its order. SC acted against them for endorsing misleading advertisements of medicinal products of Patanjali Ayurveda claiming to cure diseases permanently in violation of the law and undertaking given to the court. It made them appear before it physically on multiple hearings and they had to apologise twice as the court had rejected their first apology as it was not unconditional.
Article Summary: Baba Ramdev and Acharya Balkrishna have been facing the heat of contempt of court for last five months. SC decided to close the proceedings against them by accepting their unconditional apology. It, however, warned them with swift action if they do not honour the court and its order.

Article Title: Bail rule, jail exception even in special law like UAPA: Supreme Court
Article Text:
Times View It is an established judicial view that bail should be the norm and jail the exception. By clarifying that this principle applies not just in cases of routine crime but even where the charges are under special laws like UAPA, the apex court has made an important ruling.

NEW DELHI: In an important ruling, Supreme Court Tuesday held that the conventional idea ‘ bail is the rule , jail is an exception ’ should be applicable not only to IPC offences but also to others for which special statutes like Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act have been enacted if the conditions prescribed under that law are fulfilled.While granting bail to a former constable of Bihar Police who was charged under the stringent UAPA because of his alleged association with the outlawed Islamist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI), a bench of Justices Abhay S Oka and Augustine George Masih emphasised that courts should not hesitate in granting bail in serious offences if a case is made out for bail.Recently, the apex court, through its various verdicts, had diluted stringent provisions for bail under special laws, like it did in the Manish Sisodia case when it held that delay in trial and long incarceration could be grounds for bail despite the tough triple test in the anti-laundering act PMLA.Interestingly, just six months ago on Feb 9, another SC bench had held that ‘bail is the rule, jail is an exception’ was not applicable when an accused was facing charges under anti-terror law UAPA and, also, held that delayed trial proceedings in grave offences could not be a ground to seek bail.In the case on Tuesday, the court noted that the accused had been in custody for more than two years and the trial had not commenced. It said the trial court and Patna high court erred in rejecting his bail plea as they did not objectively analyse the evidence and their main focus was on the activities of PFI which the accused was alleged to be associated with.“When a case is made out for grant of bail, courts should not have any hesitation in granting bail. The allegations of the prosecution may be very serious. But the duty of courts is to consider the case for grant of bail in accordance with the law. ‘Bail is the rule and jail is an exception’ is a settled law. Even in a case like the present case where there are stringent conditions for the grant of bail in the relevant statutes, the same rule holds good with the only modification that bail can be granted if the conditions in the statute are satisfied. The rule also means that once a case is made out for grant of bail, the court cannot decline to grant bail. If courts start denying bail in deserving cases, it will be a violation of the rights guaranteed under Article 21 of our Constitution,” the bench said.On Feb 9, the court had ruled to the contrary. “The conventional idea in bail jurisprudence vis-a-vis ordinary penal offences that the discretion of courts must tilt in favour of the oft-quoted phrase ‘bail is the rule, jail is the exception’, unless circumstances justify otherwise, does not find any place while dealing with bail applications under UAPA. The ‘exercise’ of the general power to grant bail under UAPA is severely restrictive in scope. The form of the words used in proviso to Section 43D (5) — ‘shall not be released’ — in contrast with the form of the words as found in Section 437(1) CrPC — ‘may be released’ — suggests the intention of the legislature to make bail the exception and jail the rule,” the court had said.In the Patna case, the prosecution alleged that the accused was associated with PFI and he let out one floor of his house to members of the outfit to carry out illegal activities. It was also alleged that he was part of the meeting where PFI members discussed plans to kill BJP’s Nupur Sharma for her statements on Prophet Mohammed. But the court said the evidence and statements of witnesses falsified the allegation that he was present in the meeting.The court said there was nothing in the chargesheet which showed that the accused had taken part or had committed unlawful activities as defined in UAPA and no specific material was there to show that he advocated, abetted or incited commission of any unlawful activities.Analysing the evidence and statements of witnesses threadbare, the bench said on plain reading of the chargesheet, it was not possible to record a conclusion that there were reasonable grounds for believing that the charges against the accused of commission of offences punishable under UAPA were prima facie true.“There is not even an allegation in the chargesheet that the appellant was a member of any terrorist gang. As regards the second part of being a member of a terrorist organisation, as per Section 2(m), a terrorist organisation means an organisation listed in the first schedule or an organisation operating under the same name as the organisation was listed. The chargesheet does not mention the name of the terrorist organisation within the meaning of Section 2(m) of which the appellant was a member. We find that PFI is not a terrorist organisation, as is evident from the first schedule,” it said. PFI and its affiliates were termed “unlawful association” under UAPA and banned by govt in Sept 2022. The first schedule of UAPA lists terrorist organisations.
Article Summary: It is an established judicial view that bail should be the norm and jail the exception. By clarifying that this principle applies not just in cases of routine crime but even where the charges are under special laws like UAPA, the apex court has made an important ruling.

Article Title: EC to talk to home secretary on Jammu & Kashmir security today
Article Text:
TOI

TOI

TOI

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission will hold consultations with the Union home secretary Wednesday to assess the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir ahead of scheduling assembly polls in the Union Territory, besides discussing the possible challenges and concerns as well as availability of security forces .Some key concerns likely to come up during the deliberations between EC — represented by CEC Rajiv Kumar and election commissioners Gyanesh Kumar and S S Sandhu — and Union home secretary Ajay Bhalla include arranging the force logistics to secure the candidates, campaign meetings and electors, particularly as the recent uptick in terrorist activities in Jammu region has led to redeployment of forces to secure the mountain tops and counter the foreign terrorists hiding there.Even Kashmir districts like Kulgam and Anantnag have seen attacks on security personnel of late, and counter-terror operations are underway to trace and neutralise the perpetrators.EC sources toldthat the requirement of security forces for poll deployment is assessed as “very high” as their stepped-up presence is crucial to creating a conducive security atmosphere for campaigning and polling. More than 16,000 personnel will be needed to extend security to an average 15 candidates in each of J&K’s 90 assembly constituencies.“Democracy is to be strengthened layer by layer... increasing voting percentage is just one layer, the others being facilitating participation by a large number of candidates, more poll rallies and meetings and the wider use of IT applications like CVigil etc. EC is committed to holding the polls in J&K with all the layers strengthened,” CEC Rajiv Kumar toldSome other factors to be considered by EC are climatic conditions in J&K, apple harvesting season, and expected seasonal migration of nomadic tribes like Gujjars and Bakarwals from the higher reaches to lower ground, over Sept and Oct.The EC had indicated its intent to hold J&K polls within the Sept 30 deadline set by the Supreme Court by announcing the special summary revision of electoral rolls in J&K and other poll-bound states in June. An EC team visited J&K last week to assess poll preparedness and has now set up the customary meeting with MHA to discuss the security arrangements.A source said the publication of revised J&K electoral roll with July 1, 2024 as reference date, on Aug 20 and the conclusion of Amarnath Yatra on Aug 19, shall pave the way for EC to announce polls any day after Aug 20.Sources in the J&K security establishment said that while there are concerns about the surge in terror strikes in Jammu, “the fact remains that most of these attacks were the handiwork of foreign terrorists and targeted at security forces”. “The threat to J&K elections may, on the other hand, emanate from local terrorists and sleeper modules and target candidates and other civilians. J&K Police have largely controlled the situation in the flat areas of Kashmir and even Jammu, though the hilly regions remain a challenge. Terrorists may still carry out surprise attacks, but J&K Police are fully prepared for conduct of assembly polls as and when the EC directs,” a senior police officer told
Article Summary: The Election Commission will hold consultations with the Union home secretary Wednesday to assess the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir. More than 16,000 personnel will be needed to extend security to an average 15 candidates in each of J&K’s 90 assembly constituencies.

Article Title: Northern Army Commander visits Doda-Kishtwar, reviews anti-terror ops in Chenab region
Article Text: JAMMU: Ahead of Independence Day, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief (GOC-in-C) Lt Gen MV Suchindra Kumar visited forward locations of Counter Insurgency Force (Delta) in J&K’s Doda and Kishtwar districts Tuesday and exhorted officers of all ranks to maintain the tempo of anti-terror operations to ensure security of ongoing and upcoming national events in the region.In light of increased terrorist activity, Lt Gen Kumar reviewed the ongoing anti-terror operations in Chenab region . He also assessed options for deploying additional forces being inducted into the area and stressed on Army’s synergy with J&K Police and paramilitary forces, a Northern Command spokesperson said.Security forces have been combing the interiors of Jammu division following a spurt in terrorist violence since June 9 when an ambush on a pilgrim bus in Reasi district left nine people dead. Security forces lost 11 men — 10 soldiers and one CRPF head constable — in subsequent attacks in Kathua and Doda districts. On July 10, terrorists attacked a police picket in Basantgarh and fled. Earlier, a village defence guard named M Sharif was killed during a gunfight between security forces and terrorists in Panara village of Basantgarh on April 28.The Udhampur-Samba-Kathua region, sharing a border and characterised by thick forests and mountainous terrain, provide terrorists with ample cover to evade detection. Terrorists crossing the Pakistan border had been known to use the Bani-Basantgarh route from Kathua as a conduit to enter Doda and then proceed to Kashmir valley.
Article Summary: Lt Gen MV Suchindra Kumar visited forward locations of Counter Insurgency Force (Delta) in J&K’s Doda and Kishtwar districts. Security forces have been combing the interiors of Jammu division following a spurt in terrorist violence.

Article Title: Scheduled Castes: VCK up against sub-categorisation of SC by states
Article Text: CHENNAI: VCK leader Thol Thirumavalavan on Tuesday led a protest against Supreme Court verdict that permits states to create sub-categorization among Scheduled Castes for reservation . The party opposed court's suggestion to exclude the creamy layer among Scheduled Castes from the quota system.Expressing concerns that giving states power could lead to arbitrary decisions, Thirumavalavan said issues affecting Dalits should be addressed solely by Parliament .“If it is handed over to the state, they will exclude anyone and include anyone in the SC list. They will disintegrate the community in future. The community which accounts for 35% of the total population in the country will never emerge as a political force,” Thirumavalavan said. He alleged that the previous AIADMK regime extended the vanniyar quota for political gains without consulting other parties and the court struck it down later.Thirumavalavan demanded clarity from Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the govt’s stance regarding exclusion of creamy layer from reservations.
Article Summary: VCK leader Thol Thirumavalavan led a protest against Supreme Court verdict that permits states to create sub-categorization among Scheduled Castes for reservation. The party opposed court's suggestion to exclude the creamy layer from the quota system.

Article Title: Mhada cautions lottery applicants against making payments on fake website
Article Text: MUMBAI: Housing agency Mhada has approached the cyber crime cell of the Mumbai Police against unknown persons for creating a fake website similar to its own. Individuals who are applying for flats under Mhada's ongoing housing lottery are at risk should they pay money using the fake site.The official site of Mhada is http://mhada.gov.in whereas the fake one is mhada.org `The fraudsters actually took a gullible applicant to a Mhada apartment in Goregaon and informed him that its price was Rs 30 lakh, after which he was made to pay the amount online through the payment link on the fake site.It is believed that around four people have fallen victim to the fraud ,'' said a Mhada spokesperson.``The structure of the home page, address and front page of the fake website is similar to the official web site of Mhada. However, this fake site has provided the option of direct payment without the application process... An amount of Rs 50,000 was paid online through a link provided by the fake website. A fake receipt has also been made available from the same fraudulent site,'' said the spokesperson.A cyber police officer said that they have received an alert from Mhada about a fake website created by scammers to dupe people who are applying for the housing lottery scheme. ``Mhada will come with the complaint on Wednesday, based on which the FIR will be registered and further probe will be carried out,'' said the officer.The housing board recently announced the release of 2,030 flats in various projects in Mumbai. Sanjeev Jaiswal, vice chairman and CEO of Mhada has cautioned applicants in the state urging them to use only the official site https://housing.mhada.gov.in to participate in the lottery process. He clarified that their flats are only allotted through computerised lottery which is online and has no room for human interference.
Article Summary: Housing agency Mhada has approached the cyber crime cell of the Mumbai Police against unknown persons for creating a fake website. It is believed that around four people have fallen victim to the fraud. The housing board recently announced the release of 2,030 flats in various projects in Mumbai.

Article Title: Maniv: Hyderabad startup Fresh Bus raises $10.5M in Series-A round led by Maniv
Article Text: HYDERABAD: Fresh Bus , the Hyderabad-based all-electric intercity bus startup , on Tuesday said it has raised Rs 87.5 crore ($10.5 million approx.) through a Series-A funding round led by international early-stage transportation-focused VC fund Maniv .Other investors that participated in the round included Shell Ventures, Alteria Capital, as well as existing investor Riverwalk Holdings.Fresh Bus was previously backed by industry leaders such as CRED founder & CEO Kunal Shah, TVS Motors managing director Sudarshan Venu, and Rivigo founder & CEO Deepak Garg. Earlier, Fresh Bus had also secured an investment of Rs 16 crore from online travel operator ixigo.The startup, which has a fleet of 20 electric buses and currently operates on the Bengaluru-Tirupati and Hyderabad-Vijayawada routes, said it will be utilising the funding to beef up its fleet of e-buses. It plans to expand its network by adding 15 new routes and rolling out 150 new e-buses soon.The startup, which has already catered to over 4 lakh passengers so far, is working towards the goal of setting up a nationwide network to emerge as a market leader for intercity bussing in India in the coming years, Fresh Bus founder & CEO Sudhakar Chirra said.“We expect to scale to 1000 electric buses pan-India over the next four years, generate skilled employment opportunities for thousands of people, and offer a green alternative for mass road transportation,” he said.
Article Summary: Hyderabad-based all-electric intercity bus startup Fresh Bus said it has raised Rs 87.5 crore ($10.5 million approx.) Fresh Bus was previously backed by industry leaders such as CRED founder & CEO Kunal Shah, TVS Motors managing director Sudarshan Venu.

Article Title: Murder: Bilaspur court sentences man to death for murdering wife and three minor children in 'rarest of rare' case
Article Text: RAIPUR: The trial court of Bilaspur has convicted 34-year-old Umend Kevat for the murder of his wife and three minor children , including his 18-month-old son Pawan Kevat, under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code , and has pronounced the death penalty for the accused, considering the case as one of the rarest of the rare. Suspecting his wife's character, the accused strangled Sukrita Kevat, 32, along with their daughters Khushi Kevat, 5, Lisa Kevat, 3, and son Pawan Kevat on January 1, 2024.“Given the severity of the crime, the accused's behavior does not warrant any leniency.The act of murdering his helpless wife and children in such a brutal manner makes this case one of the ' rarest of rare ' cases, which justifies the imposition of the death penalty,” the trial court stated.The tenth Additional Sessions Judge, Bilaspur, Avinash K Tripathi, said, “The court is of the view that a witness may lie, but circumstances do not. Circumstantial evidence forms the basis of rules and law. The accused, in this case, is solely responsible for the crime from which he cannot escape. The saying 'Actions Speak Louder Than Words' applies aptly to this case. The only conclusion is that no one else has committed the crime other than the accused, Umend Kevat.”Citing Supreme Court judgments in similar cases and the circumstances of this case, the court ruled that the accused's act of killing his family was nothing less than inhumane. The victims, including the children, were innocent and helpless. After a premeditated plan, the accused killed his wife and children one by one by strangling them with a rope, likely driven by doubts about his wife’s character.The accused first took his wife outside under the pretext of some work, strangled her from behind with a rope, and then returned to the room to kill his three children. This indicates that the accused was fully aware of his actions and their consequences. The manner in which these murders were carried out reflects a calculated and deliberate plan, leaving no room for doubt that this was an exceptionally heinous crime, the trial court noted.After thoroughly examining all the circumstances and arguments presented, the court rejected the plea for leniency and sentenced the accused to death under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code, along with a fine of Rs 10,000. The court also ordered that the accused be hanged by the neck until death. This death sentence will remain subject to confirmation by the High Court as per Section 366 of the Code of Criminal Procedure.The trial court also observed that the impact of these murders is especially devastating for the surviving family members, particularly the elderly grandparents, whose only surviving relatives have now been taken from them. Given these circumstances, the court found no reason to show any leniency, concluding that Umend Kevat’s actions warrant the death penalty, which is in the best interest of society.
Article Summary: Umend Kevat, 34, convicted of murdering his wife and three minor children, including his 18-month-old son Pawan Kevat. Suspecting his wife's character, the accused strangled Sukrita Kevat along with their daughters Khushi, 5, Lisa, 3, and Pawan, on January 1, 2024.

Article Title: MoS Margherita to visit five countries in Latin America and Caribbean region
Article Text: GUWAHATI: Minister of state for external affairs and textiles, Pabitra Margherita will embark on a 10-day official visit to five countries in Latin America and Caribbean region—Dominican Republic, Guatemala, El Salvador, Panama and Trinidad & Tobago from August 15.This will be his first foreign visit as minister of state, an official statement by ministry of external affairs stated.“Visit of the minister of state to these five countries reaffirms India’s commitment to further strengthen our ties with the countries in Latin America and Caribbean region . It provides an opportunity to explore and advance our partnership in newer areas of mutual interest,” the MEA stated.In the Dominican Republic, Margherita will attend the formal swearing-in-ceremony of President-elect Luis Abinader. He will also interact with members of the Indian diaspora there.In Guatemala, he will call on Cesar Bernardo Arevalo de Leon, President of the Republic of Guatemala. He will also have a bilateral meeting with Carlos Ramiro Martinez, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Guatemala to discuss bilateral ties. During the visit, MoS will meet members of the Chamber of Industry of Guatemala, Committee of Agricultural, Commercial, Industrial and Financial Associations (CACIF). He will also visit Antigua, the UNESCO Heritage city.In El Salvador, the MoS will call on Nayib Bukele, President of the Republic of El Salvador, and have a bilateral meeting with Alexandra Hill T, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of El Salvador and hold a series of other ministerial interactions and engagements, and also interact with Indian Diaspora.In Panama, Margherita will have delegation level talks with Javier Martinez, Foreign Minister of the Republic of Panama. He will also call on Jose Raul Mulino, President of the Republic of Panama and visit the University of Panama to pay floral tributes at the bust of Mahatma Gandhi and plant a sapling as a symbolic gesture.He will also visit Panama Canal and Panama Pacifico Free Trade/ Industrial Zone facilities and interact with the Diplomatic Community and prominent members of the Indian Diaspora during a reception hosted in the honour of MoS.In Trinidad and Tobago, MoS will have a meeting with Dr. Amery Browne, Minister for Foreign & CARICOM Affairs. He will call on. Dr. Keith Rowley, Prime Minister of Republic of Trinidad and Tobago and will also interact with members of the Indian community.
Article Summary: Pabitra Margherita will embark on a 10-day official visit to five countries in Latin America and Caribbean region. This will be his first foreign visit as minister of state. He will visit Dominican Republic, Guatemala, El Salvador, Panama and Trinidad & Tobago.

Article Title: 'State govt wants to help accused': Congress's Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Kolkata rape-murder
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury hit out at the Mamata government just as the political tussle over the Kolkata doctor rape-murder case went up a notch on Tuesday. The former Berhampore MP , while condemning the incident, accused the state government of being in a fix and wanting to help the preparator behind the brutal rape-murder."It is condemnable. The state government should take action but it is still in dilemma. The law and order situation is getting worse. The state govt is not capable, and it wants to help the accused," he told news agency ANI.Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury also reacted to the incident, saying that such events should not occur and that doctors must be ensured safety.Meanwhile, the CBI took over the probe into the rape and murder of the postgraduate trainee doctor at the Calcutta HC's order.Earlier, the high court observed that the then principal of the medical college, Sandip Ghosh, should have been questioned first in connection with the case. During the hearing, the chief justice questioned the appointment of the former principal."How can the principal - who resigned by taking moral responsibility, be appointed as the principal of another government college? The court has asked him to submit a leave application by 3 pm today or the court will pass an order for him to leave the position," the court observed."Why are you protecting him? Record his statement. Let him tell whatever he knows," the court asked the state counsel.The post-graduate trainee doctor was found dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on August 9. An investigation confirmed rape and murder. The deceased's body showed signs of a struggle, including scratch marks. The family has alleged that the victim was raped and murdered.
Article Summary: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury hit out at the Mamata government. He accused the state government of being in a fix and wanting to help the preparator behind the brutal rape-murder. The CBI took over the probe into the rape and murder of the postgraduate trainee doctor.

Article Title: Chhattisgarh: Chhattisgarh: Six students injured as classroom ceiling plaster caves in govt school
Article Text: RAIPUR : At least six children of Class VI were wounded when a huge plaster of the classroom ceiling collapsed when the students were sitting in class, at a govt school in Janjgir Champa district in Chhattisgarh on Tuesday.Amid several incidents of portions of school walls or ceilings collapsing and leaving students injured , the incident took place on Tuesday morning at the village Putpura govt school.The students were sitting in class when a plaster from the ceiling caved in.One girl sustained severe injuries to her head, and five others, including one boy, were also wounded. There was chaos for a moment, and the students were rescued and rushed to the hospital. They were provided with primary treatment and admitted to the hospital. Their condition is stated to be stable.The students and parents are in shock and are demanding an explanation followed by action in the matter. The parents said they will not be able to send their children to school until the building is repaired.The school management said that they have been asking for repairs or a new premise for the school for a long time, as the building is in a dilapidated condition and it becomes risky during incessant rainfall.A teacher said that it was only yesterday that a proposal was approved for demolition of the building and a new premises should be constructed.TOI tried calling District Education Officer Ashwani Bhardwaj, but he wasn’t available for comments.District collector Akash Chikara visited the hospital to meet students.
Article Summary: The incident took place on Tuesday morning at the village Putpura govt school. The students were sitting in class when a plaster from the ceiling caved in. One girl sustained severe injuries to her head, and five others, including one boy, were also wounded.

Article Title: HC overturns man’s conviction for rape of daughter after 9 years in jail
Article Text: PILIBHIT: Babu Ram , a resident of Turkpur Barhwar village under the jurisdiction of Neuria police station, was released from Pilibhit district jail on Monday after the Allahabad high court overturned his conviction for repeatedly raping his minor daughter. The order was passed by a division bench of Justice Ashwani Kumar Mishra and Justice Dr. Gautam Chaudhary on August 8.Upon his release, Ram said, "Who will return the nine years of my innocence which I spent in jail bearing the stigma of raping my own daughter for 13 months?"Ram was sentenced to life imprisonment by the court of Additional Sessions Judge in Pilibhit on Feb 24, 2018, for the repeated sexual assaults.He was also sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment under IPC sections 376(2)(F) and 376(2)(N), based on an FIR filed on June 2, 2015, by his stepson, Sandeep. Ram had been in jail since his arrest, as he was never granted bail.Jitendra Pal Singh , Ram's lawyer, said, “The medical examination of the victim, who is around 14 to 15 years old, showed no signs of external or internal injuries and no spermatozoa were found in the pathological examination of her vaginal slides. Despite these findings, the trial court focused on the victim's statement recorded under CrPC section 164, in which she accused her father of repeatedly raping her.”“The high court, however, considered the supplementary medical reports and the testimony of Dr Anjali Singh, who conducted the victim's examination. She testified that in cases of sexual assault, some signs should be evident on the victim's body, which was not the case here. The court also noted the improbability of the victim being raped repeatedly over a year without anyone noticing, especially as she lived with her grandparents near the house of the accused,” he added.
Article Summary: Allahabad high court overturns Babu Ram's conviction for repeatedly raping his minor daughter. Ram was sentenced to life imprisonment by the court of Additional Sessions Judge in Pilibhit on Feb 24, 2018. Ram had been in jail since his arrest, as he was never granted bail.

Article Title: AAP launches 'Satyamev Jayate' campaign post Manish Sisodia's bail
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Aam Aadmi Party ( AAP ) initiated the " Satyamev Jayate " display picture campaign on social media platforms on Tuesday, shortly after Manish Sisodia , a prominent party leader, was released from Tihar jail on bail granted by the Supreme Court in cases related to the excise policy.Atishi, an AAP leader and Delhi minister, announced that starting from 3 pm on Tuesday, all party leaders and members would use the "Satyamev Jayate" display picture on their social media profiles.Atishi said, "We want to tell the BJP that no matter how much it harasses us or keeps our leaders in jail for long, ultimately, the truth will prevail." She emphasized that the Supreme Court's decision to grant bail to Sisodia, who spent 17 months in prison, was a "triumph of truth".AAP has launched the campaign, pushing all party leaders and supporters to use the Satyamev Jayate display picture on their X, WhatsApp, and Facebook accounts starting from Tuesday.The display picture features images of Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia against a background of the party's colors. The phrase "Satyamev Jayate" is written in Hindi at the top of the display picture, while an image of the AAP's election symbol, a broom, is positioned at the bottom."Satyamev Jayate" is derived from a hymn in the Mundaka Upanishad, which translates to "truth alone triumphs."
Article Summary: AAP has launched the campaign, pushing all party leaders and supporters to use the Satyamev Jayate display picture on their X, WhatsApp, and Facebook accounts starting from Tuesday. Atishi said, "We want to tell the BJP that no matter how much it harasses us or keeps our leaders in jail for long, ultimately, the truth will prevail"

Article Title: NCERT: Chhattisgarh prepares textbook writing for schools as per National Education Policy
Article Text: RAIPUR: Chhattisgarh has embarked on its journey towards the national education policy as it begins the preparatory process of textbook writing and curriculum development for school students in accordance with the norms of NCERT . Chhattisgarh is the first state to have taken this initiative with the aim of introducing changes in the curriculum by the next academic session for Classes 1-3 and 6, officials said.Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai has urged and directed officers to expedite the process for the sincere implementation of the national education policy in Chhattisgarh.CM Sai initiated the organisation of a two-day long state-level textbook writing orientation workshop on Tuesday to discuss and bring necessary changes in school textbooks in line with the new education policy. The workshop focuses on planning the improvements to be made in textbooks for grades 1-3 and 6 from next year. The State Council of Educational Research and Training is leading the orientation programme, officials said.School Education Secretary Siddharth Komal Singh Pardeshi emphasised during the workshop that students should be taught in their local language from the foundational stage. “The main focus to be made in textbooks would be that they have a practical approach for understanding the lessons, and efforts will be made to improve them using NCERT's guidance. Chhattisgarh is currently working on introducing 20 languages in textbooks, and efforts are on to make textbooks more creative and attractive along with a touch of local relevance,” Pardeshi said.In a virtual address, Professor Ranjana Arora, Head of the Curriculum Department at NCERT New Delhi, said that Chhattisgarh is the first state to start the process of creating textbooks for its schools in collaboration with NCERT, in line with the national education policy. NCERT and SCERT are set to do significant and commendable work together. She said that SCERT experts will incorporate the state's local language, dialect, and characteristics during the process.
Article Summary: Chhattisgarh is the first state to have taken this initiative with the aim of introducing changes in the curriculum by the next academic session for Classes 1-3 and 6. Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai has urged and directed officers to expedite the process for the sincere implementation of the national education policy.

Article Title: CBI takes over investigation into Kolkata doctor's rape-murder case after HC order
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Central Bureau of Investigation ( CBI ) has taken over the investigation on Tuesday into the rape and murder of a woman doctor at a state-run medical college in Kolkata, as per officials.The agency promptly completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court 's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency.On Wednesday early morning, a team of CBI officials from Delhi, accompanied by forensic scientists and medical experts, will visit Kolkata. The High Court had earlier directed the state police to hand over the case diary to the CBI by 10 AM on Wednesday.The postgraduate trainee's body was discovered on Friday morning inside a seminar hall of the state-run RG Kar hospital, where she was allegedly raped and murdered. A civic volunteer was arrested in connection with the case on Saturday. The preliminary autopsy report indicated that the victim had been sexually abused and murdered, with injuries observed on her eyes, mouth, private parts, left leg, neck, right hand, ring finger, and lips.The Kolkata Police had arrested a 33-year-old individual who joined the force as a civic volunteer in 2019. The police alleged that the accused was married at least four times and was known as a "womaniser". The accused, a trained boxer, had developed close relationships with a few senior police officers over the years, leading to his transfer to the Kolkata Police Welfare Board and posting at the police outpost at the state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital, where the incident occurred.
Article Summary: The CBI completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency. The postgraduate trainee's body was discovered on Friday morning inside a seminar hall of the state-run RG Kar hospital. A civic volunteer was arrested in connection with the case on Saturday.

Article Title: Chhattisgarh leads India's charge with first Lithium mine in Korba
Article Text: RAIPUR: India is set to open its first lithium mines in the Katghora region of Korba district of Chhattisgarh following confirmation of significant lithium deposits by the Geological Survey of India (GSI).The decision to open the lithium mines was announced during the sixth governing body meeting of the National Mineral Exploration Trust in New Delhi on Monday.The GSI reported lithium concentrations of 10 to 2,000 parts per million (PPM) across approximately 250 hectares, with potential for even higher content.The meeting of the National Mineral Exploration Trust was chaired by Union Minister G Kishan Reddy and discussions were done on how the extraction and utilization of minerals can be done along with conservation of nature and the environment.State health minister Shyam Bihari Jaiswal attended the meeting as a representative of Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai, stating that lithium is currently a crucial metal that will lead the state and country towards new dimensions of development.The minister said, “With the commencement of the lithium mine in the state, Chhattisgarh will become one of the leading states in the country to contribute much more to the vision of developed India by 2047.”Ministry of Mines had issued a Notice Inviting Tender (NIT) on the MSTC portal for the allocation of 20 critical and strategic mineral blocks, including those in Bihar, Gujarat, Jharkhand, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, and Chhattisgarh through e-auction.According to information shared by officials in the state mining department, among these 20 blocks, the lithium and Rare Earth Element (REE) block in Katghora area was included. Preliminary surveys by GSI have found lithium content ranging from 10 PPM to 2,000 PPM in an area of approximately 250 hectares. The block also contains rare earth elements.Critical and strategic minerals are required for renewable energy, defence, agriculture, pharmaceuticals, high-tech electronics, telecommunications, and transportation and currently, the country relies on imports for these minerals.Lithium was among the 23 proposals by state for exploration projects and is considered as a critical mineral used in making lithium-ion batteries used in electric vehicles, the demand of which has grown exponentially.Chhattisgarh has generated approximately Rs 13,000 crore in mineral revenue in 2023-24, which is nearly 30 times more than the year of state formation.
Article Summary: The decision to open the lithium mines was announced during the sixth governing body meeting of the National Mineral Exploration Trust in New Delhi. The GSI reported lithium concentrations of 10 to 2,000 parts per million (PPM) across approximately 250 hectares, with potential for even higher content.

Article Title: Hindenburg report: Government unlikely to wade into row, officials say report 'malicious'
Article Text:
Top Picks For You Hindenburg Report: Full statement of Sebi chief, her husband after irregularities allegations

NEW DELHI: Government is unlikely to immediately step into the controversy created by the Hindenburg report as senior officials believe that the charges against Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband Dhaval, are "untrue and malicious" and are in response to the regulator 's notice to the short seller.They alleged that Hindenburg may also be trying to make a quick buck from the Indian markets through its latest action and the regulator and govt are keeping a close tab on how the developments unfold.Describing it as a fresh attempt to "create a smokescreen", a govt source suggested that this may be part of a larger attempt to discredit the regulator at a time when the Indian stock market is seeing a good run on the back of healthy macroeconomic fundamentals and strong growth prospects with clean corporate and bank balance sheets. The source alleged such actions were part of a pattern to hit Indian markets but argued that the markets were now strong and deep enough to withstand Hindenburg-type attacks."There have been a series of regulatory actions to improve the overall functioning of the markets and the regulator itself has not shied away from cautioning investors, wherever it sees pressure building up," another official said, while listing out a host of measures taken by Sebi. The officer said that Sebi has submitted its probe findings on issues raised by Hindenburg in its earlier report to the Supreme Court.Pointing to the statements issued by Madhabi Puri Buch and Dhaval Buch , who both worked in the private sector, officials said required disclosures had been made, which may not be in public domain like those of civil servants.While suggesting that some of Puri Buch's actions may have upset some of the market participants, sources said, the regulator has followed an elaborate consultation paper, even in the case of REITs, amid suggestions by Hindenburg that the rules benefited Blackstone, where Dhaval is an adviser.Market players are closely monitoring govt's response, given that Puri Buch has over six months to go as Sebi chief and is eligible for another term. She took over as Sebi chief in March 2022 and was given a three-year term.
Article Summary: Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband Dhaval Buch are accused of irregularities. Officials believe the charges are "untrue and malicious" and are in response to the regulator's notice to the short seller. They alleged that Hindenburg may also be trying to make a quick buck from the Indian markets.
